document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Urogaster opacus
Ashmead, 1905: 118
. Holotype ♀ — Luzon , Philippines [USNM].

Apanteles cavatiptera Chen & Song, 2004: 33
. Syn. nov.

Apanteles glacilipes Song & Chen, 2004: 52
. Syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 3.0 mm, fore wing length 3.4 mm . Body black, hind femur yellow, except brownish at apex. Ocelli large, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus not touching posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus slightly shorter than diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna about as long as body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.5× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum distinctly smaller than its diameter. Areola on propodeum closed, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae, posterio-lateral parts with some carinae. Pterostigma 2.3× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.3× longer than pterostigma, vein r 2.2× longer than vein 2-SR, angled at junction. T1 parallel-sided, 2.8× longer than hind width, turned-over part dull, with longitudinal striation laterally, longitudinal channel distinct; T2 shiny, except a few weak punctures, 3.6× wider than long in the middle; T3 2.3× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath slightly shorter than hind tibia.

Hosts. According to the label,
Diaphania indica (Saunders)
,
Pectinophora gossypiella (Saunders)
. According to literature,
Sylepta derogate Fabr
,
Etiella zinckenella Treitschke
[
Glycine max
],
Haritalodes derogata (Fabr)
,
Pericallia ricini Fabr
,
Pleuroptya ruralis (Scopoli)
[
Glycine max
] and
Scirpophaga nivella Fabr
[
Erianthus munja
] (
Yu et al . 2016
).

Distribution. China (Anhu, Chongqing , Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Henan , Hubei , Hunan , Jiangsu , Liaoning , Shaanxi , Shanghai , Sichuan , Taiwan , Yunnan, Zhejiang); India , Japan , Malaysia , Philippines , Vietnam .

Remarks. According to Chen & Yang (2004),
A. cavatiptera Chen & Song
was similar to
A. opacus (Ashmead)
except T2 was longer, vein r was indistinctly angled with 2-SR, and hind femur was blackish brown in the latter.
A. glacilipes Song & Chen
was similar to
A. derogate Watanabe
except longer antenna and ovipositor sheath and yellowish T 3 in the latter.
Apanteles derogate
is junior synonym of
A. opacus (Ashmead)
. Based on numerous specimens studied above, we believe
A. cavatiptera Chen & Song
and
A. glacilipes Song & Chen
are also junior synonyms of
A. opacus (Ashmead)
and characters mentioned above are within its variation.
